title: Regional energy consumption
description: Deploy an area chart to compare the annual energy consumption of different regions, using 'lightgrey' for North America, 'turquoise' for Europe, and 'lightpink' for Asia.
solution:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import plotly.express as px

colors = {'north_america': 'lightgrey', 'europe': 'turquoise', 'asia': 'lightpink'}
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
df.plot(kind='area', stacked=True, color=[colors[col] for col in df.columns])
plt.title('Annual Energey Consumption by Region')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Energy Consumption (TWh)')
plt.legend(title='Regions')
plt.grid(axis='y')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.show()
